Body: Possible Duplicate:  How do I root my phone?  I have found some decent guides on how to root your Android device on various forums, but I would interested in hearing what everyone hear feels is the ideal checklist when rooting.  For instance, when I did my first root recently it was something like this:Download and run z4root.Download, install, and run Boostrap RecoveryCreate a backup of the current ROMDownload, install, and run Titanium backupInstall apps that need root to run... etcIf there is more to add, please let me know.    NOTE: Additionally, if this question is too device-centric, let me know and I will either edit it or close it.  Thanks.
Title: Can someone provide a list of the things to ideally do when rooting?

history.Text: I have found some decent guides on how to root your Android device on various forums, but I would interested in hearing what everyone hear feels is the ideal checklist when rooting.  For instance, when I did my first root recently it was something like this: 1. Download and run z4root. 2. Download, install, and run Boostrap Recovery 3. Create a backup of the current ROM 4. Download, install, and run Titanium backup 5. Install apps that need root to run  ... etcIf there is more to add, please let me know.    NOTE: Additionally, if this question is too device-centric, let me know and I will either edit it or close it.  Thanks.
Can someone provide a list of the things  to ideally do when rooting?

For instance, when I did my first root recently it was something like this: 1. Download and run z4root. 2. Download, install, and run Boostrap Recovery 3. Create a backup of the current ROM 4. Download, install, and run Titanium backup 5. Install apps that need root to run  ... etcIf there is more to add, please let me know.
